heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 08 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 426 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 5.1°C), cloud levels (up 750 m), outside temperature (up 4.6°C), and dew point temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 425.7m lower than yesterday, 619.5m lower than the past week, 750.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 696m and a high of 1841m, averaging 829.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 1.8°C higher than yesterday, 2.5°C lower than the past week, 2.7°C lower than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between -0.5°C minimum and 9.8°C maximum, with an average of 6.1°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 8.7°C and 8.9°C.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and it’s dark. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (95%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
